intro: Crantzia ovata, commonly known as the oval crantzia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are oval-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, forming dense clusters. Crantzia ovata is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and ornamental appeal.
